intro: Hyalis marginifolia, commonly known as the margin-leaf hyalis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are elliptical with a distinctive white or pale green margin, giving it its common name. Hyalis marginifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
